intro: Senecio pomacochana, commonly known as the Andean groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to the harsh, cold climate of its native environment. Senecio pomacochana is often used in traditional medicine by local communities for its potential therapeutic properties.
